lines.text: FILL-IN RELEASE #4
C
NoTE: This jlease must be copied fill-
Service Packet
ing in the required information before
SUGGESTED TEAT FOR EDITORIAL
being released to local newspapers.
It has been announced that the American Cancer Society organization
in this community is about to activate a cancer patient service project here.
This is a very worthy endeavor and it receives our whole-hearted endorsement.
The aCS officials say that they will need a lot of volunteers and
it is possible they will have trouble in finding all the hands they need to
do the many chores planned.
Most everybody is interested in the cancer control program. Here
as in most every other
in the country, our people
(town, cityor county
have supported the ACS Cancer Crusade with funds and most of us feel we are a
direct part of the vast research program that our money has gone to support.
There certainly is something thrilling and dramatic about the scientists'
vital race with time in their quest for the secrets of cancer -- secrets
that eventually will lead to complete conquest over this fearful disease.
There is great satisfaction too to know that our money has helped to pay
for educational programs that actually are saving lives -- at least 7o,00o
of them throughout the U.S. in 195l -- by alerting people to cancer's early
symptoms.
But in the meantime, many others are critically ill -- some beyond
hope. It is with these people that the ACS service program is concerned.
is no exception. The ACS service program
(Name of community)
in this
can do much to alleviate the suffering of cancer
(city, town, county).
patients, particularly those at home. It requires brave, sincere people to
volunteer for this work. There is nothing glamorous about sitting up with
a patient while the wife or mother takes an evening off -- or using your car
to drive a cancer patient to the hospital for treatment - or delivering to
the home some of the 25o odd items that the ACS lends or gives to help make
